reviews.review: One of the best in the world... Koç family, particularly Mr. Rahmi Koç is the greatest philantrophist in Turkey. Besides many cultural activities, museums and foundations they have created this ecclectic museum that encomposses industrial and manufacturing history with unique and priceless examples.From naval ships to submarines, old tailor signs to classic cars and many more.It is a once in a lifetime experience which you should spare at least one full day.It is also a shining monument to Turkish Museum inventory many to the world's..Karaca B.from Constantinople.
industrial history museum. items on show range from typewriter to navy submarine. interested in mechanics, this museum is a must to see.

Very good Experience. the museum having different section as you can see the old cars and old boats old airplanes old ships and there is section for kids they can enjoy playing and drawing with colors.

Don t miss. It s a very good idea to take your family to Rahmi museum,there s has a lot to c there,.. toys,cars boats ,cars etc,you can spend their easily 3 to 4 hours,I recommend you to go on weekend day ,to have the opportunity to have a short golden horn trip (35min), by using the old boat (Rosali),and on the same time to use the old train in a short trip.
great. Great museum, can spend whole day there. The best part is visiting of real u-boat (for additional fee).

Excellent and well organised. I extremely recommend this museum for old cars lovers. For all other people of different agess this place is full of history and entertainments.My wife, small child and I have enjoyed it so much.

Best Industrial Museum in Turkey. It is the best museum I have ever visited. 27.000 square meters need a full day. I definitely recommend below:1. The submarine experience- you need to buy an additional ticket from the desk. 2. Historical tram trip on the coast of golden horn- you need to get a voucher from the desk- free of charge. Both submarine and tram are scheduled tours so you need to check the hours so you experience both of them. 3. Dc-3 airplane that you can visit interior as well. 4.Cars like ford t, trabi,etc. 5. The original telegram patented by Edison. On top of everything, you have the option of parking free of charge.

An industrial museum. This is a museum full of cars, machinery, scientific developments and even a submarine. It is near the seaside. Easy to go and spend relaxed time, especially if you are interested in technology. This is also a favorite destination for school trips. Te museum has facilities that you can organize business events like reseller meetings and has got the catering facilities.
An interesting museum . Very interesting museum full of beautiful cars planes trains boats and a submarine with a full historic review of each one of them A must see if you are in Istanbul

A must see in İstanbul. The exceptional collection of the Koç family has been well displayed and is an amazing array of things to see. Highly recommended especially alot of fun for kids. My grandsons had a marvelous time and would like to go back again.

a personal collection became an incredible museum. I have been here three times and each time I discovered different things. one day is never enough to go into details. you will see a great collection of things from various parts of the world.

A nice collection of historical craft. As you wind your way up the Golden Horn, the Rahmi m> Koc Museum is a good place to spend an hour or so. The collection includes a Turkish submarine, locomotives, historical boats of the Bosporus, and much more. The cafe on the Halic is also a pleasant place to grab a drink before continuing on your journey. Worth the stop.

Prepare for a long, joyful and informative day. Rahmi Koç Museum is a very joyful and informative place for both children and adults. Don't miss to book the free of charge train in the information desk. You should visit the submarine. Master Captain Mr.Oğuz İşleyenel guided us and gave a certificate as a souvenir which kids liked the most. They wished he was their teacher at school. Thank you :)
Nice. Very interesting place o to visit both for adults and kids. You must spend almost all day to see all the museum offers

Koc Museum one of the best places to visit in Istanbul.. The Koc museum is a technology museum full of, historical mechanical, electronics parts, cars, bicycles, boats, ship models, even a submarine and a classical Istanbul city ship. Is has a nice part for kids where they can see/experience some scientific games/experiments. Nice cafes inside. You can combine your visit with Miniaturk which is very close.

Incredible, amazing!!. I knew about the Koc museum from reports by members of family and I was looking forward to visiting it. I had already seen part of it from the water. And it didn't disappoint me at all. It is incredible what a person's generosity can do when we follow our dreams and passions and share them with other people. It's really overwhelming the number of things you can see, admire, learn from ...there. And it's so well taken care of!! Highly recommended.

Fascinating . Visiting Rahmi m. Koç museum both in Ankara and Istanbul was a bold part of my trip in turkey. I think it would be a nice experience for any one interested in technology history and Models. There are many nice and unique still models, working models and real pieces of technology and design. The museum in Istanbul have a bigger collection of unique cars, boats, ships and also a nice submarine which served at 2nd world war.... don't miss it. You can spend a full day on this.

One of the Best Museums anywhere. A private museum of Rahmi Koç, celebrated Turkish industrialist. The museum features many personal items of Rahmi Koç and also other items collected or loaned to the museum.Collections include a very large number of cars, motorcycles, horse-drawn carriages along with trains, boats & ships, models, a submarine and 4 aircraft to name but a few.I visit this museum often both alone & with friends who visit my family. I never tire of visiting as its such a nice museum & very interesting. It's possible to spend full days there.Discount available for Istanbulkart, but nothing to worry about. It's great value.Highly Recommended visit when in Istanbul.
for families. This is a very special place for the families .You can stay there long time with the children they will like very much.
Very big private musem. The museum has a real sub-marine, a big ship, a plane, lost of trains and very old cars. They have a good collection of cars. Also there are near history technological stuff.

One of the best science/ industry museums. Having been to science/car/ rail/ ship and industry museums from Santiago to Sydney, have to say this is one of the worlds best. Huge car, bike, train, tram, plane etc collection, and across the road in the old building, amazing museum of everything from cinema to household appliances. Catch the ferry up to the door.

What a great museum.. After reading about this museum we took the local bus from Eminonu. The Rahmi M. Koc Museum is a must for lovers of anything with wheels. Vintage and classic cars, motorbikes, trains, boats, toys etc etc. A fantastic collection that is well set out and beautifully displayed. Be prepared for a long visit.
Must visit kids destination. kids like all sections very much specially the IQ games section.wonderful atmosphere , i liked the cozy cafe at old cars section very much.
Beautiful!. It was a very short visit, a prize ceremony and concert, and a cocktail beforehand. But it is a nice place, beware of the traffic while going there.

Best car,boat,and train museum ever!. Great way to spend a rainy day in Istanbul. More cars, boats, and trains then I have ever seen in one museums. There is a motor demo teaching how cars work. There were brides and grooms everywhere getting pictures made by red sport cars. My husband was climbing up and down very happily. Lots of kids having fun. Spacious and clean. Don' miss it.

Different kind of museum. This one was really cool for the kids! Mr. Rahmi Koc was quite a collector and this museum has everything from cars, bikes, boats, aircrafts, horse drawn carriages, baby cribs, ........ the list goes on and on and on!!! Must Visit!
NIce...... Nice museum with a lot of stuff to see.....We loved the classic cars and boats.... A nice place for history lovers

Lots to like and easy to get to. Truly a must see museum to break up the tedium of the usual stuff. This is a conglomeration of classic cars, planes, a submarine, and classic boats with a plethora of other things like engine cutaways, models of boats. The museum is easily reached by ferry and the ferry drops on right at its door.We had lunch just across the street a half block down the side street facing the front of the museum) at Lale Locantasi. Lale is a homey non-tourist place that has a cafeteria style selection so pointing and getting is easy. quit reasonable and very good food. When we told the waiter we were too full to have dessert, he came back with a crumb cake and ice cream dessert gratis. Nice.
it was a big surprise. i didnt know that turkey had industries, well at least the way we call them in the west...but its a good family outing for the day.
Private museums?. Similar to Sabanci Museum.Like a trophy wife...Google their permanent collection, findings willeither convince you to visit this museum or skip it...

Amazing. The Koç Family has an amazing collection which also can be considered as history and development of turkey. You can see machines, how they work, the big authentic car collection and memories of family members. A must see.

The kids love it!!. It was a very educational trip because my children learn a lot about the history of transportation in Turkey and the world in general.They have a VERY good range of transport collection and information.The design of the museum is also pretty.. they also have a section on how machines we use work in our daily life (car, dishwasher, oven, vacuum cleaner washingmachine, car and lots more) which was interactive by pushing the button. Interesting!!They also have one corner display about planets.we love the museum!
children's delight. we went on a ferry that goes along the Golden Horn. It's a museum of wonders, technology, industry and lots of fun.. good food,too.

Must go. I am an engineer so definitely it is of much interest for me. This is a very nice place for people to see history of mechanized world. Here you get opportunity to see how mechanical machines are working. Submarine tour is a must who did nt have before

Nice collection worth seeing. If you are interested in cars, do not miss it! This is a one impressive collection. There is also a nice restaurant on site by the seaside if you need nourishment - a bit on the posh side.

Extraordinary. This is an interesting collection of everything realised by one of the top industrialist in Turkey.Ranging from,vintage cars,aircraft,submarine,machines,railway cars,you name it.Very well preserved and kept in the right environment.It also has a fantastic restaurant by the Golden Horn waters.

Terrific collections of cars, trolleys, boats, technology. Interesting to read about Koc on internet since museum tells very little. Had friendly, helpful staff and restaurant on the water was nice. The collection of cars and boats and trolleys was impressive as was the interactive displays for kids. Museum can be seen in 2 hours comfortably. The collections were well displayed with good information in Turkish and English on most. Having been to the most popular attractions in Istanbul previously, it was a real gem on a trip with limited leisure time.
Interesting g. Really interesting couple of hours spent here was good knowledgeable staff would recommend a visit you won't be disappointed

Wonderful!!. I was so glad we scheduled visiting this museum on a day when we didn't have any other planned activities to do since I wanted to spend as much time as I can here. I place is big, consisting of 2 buildings and a huge outdoors space. It consists of model for mainly transportation methods (cars, trains, buses, planes, ships...) but also contains other subjects such as the 'How it Works' and 'Old Shops' sections. The place also has a submarine which can be toured (with a separate ticket). The place is really informative and would be perfect for young children and adults alike.
Excellent. Love to see all the structures based in turkey. Can see whole turkey in one place that too very closely.

Brilliant place. I only heard about this place via a guide book and since I was at a loose end over a weekend on one of my many business trips to Istanbul I thought I would give it a go. My, how I was surprised. First of all I was amazed now inexpensive it was @ 15TL, the submarine was an additional 7TLSecond it is big covering a large area of ground on two sides of a road, some indoors and some outside.Third it has many sections, if you are not interested in one subject just move on to the next. If you are interested in anything mechanical there is bound to be an area to impress you.I spent about 5 absorbing hours looking at the extensive exhibitions of transportation, cars, motorcycles, farm machinery, model trains, horse carriages, boats, planes, toys, engines, reconstructed shops, models, model ships, the list goes on.I would say most items are from the 19th to 21st century and collected by the museum's namesake for their mechanical and historical significance.  The submarine trip was Ok but only in Turkish. I was given an English schematic and the official at the back of the tour did try his best to explain what things were, fortunately I have been round many WW2 subs and knew what to expect and roughly what I was looking at. At the price of less than a cup of coffee in the UK it was worth it.The place is good for children as well, having both a purpose built area exploring mathematical principles with colourful hands on experiments, and a number of interactive displays around the place. Even a small, realistic ships bridge with real controls where you could play with all the levers, wheels and buttons but that was tucked away in an area of masses of models of past ships which is a shame since that is probably not a section you would think of going with children. Signage is good in Turkish and English throughout.There is a snack bar on an old ferry , the food is homemeade, quite reasonable quality and dirt cheap at 4TL (= 1 GBP) for a baguette and some tea. The narrow guage railway trip wasnt really worth the effort , since it only went a few hundred yard in a park area beside the golden horn and back but it was free, so no compaints. The location was not easy to get to. Most people appeared to be locals who arrived by car. I actually walked the 5 miles each way from my Taksim hotel but not an easy walk. I presume taxis are are an option but I didnt see any nearby when I returned. If I could read Turkish there may be public transport options I missed.A really fascinating day out and glad I didnt miss it.
Nice but could be better. Definitely worth a visit if you love cars, don't bother about the 3d movie, it's all in Turkish, I regret getting on the submarine as again the tour is all in Turkish...

Amazing Collection of Boats and cars. Don't ever miss this museum while in Istanbul. I would like to start with the educational and historical trip they have through the galaxy, creation, computer evolution, car motors and home appliance working in a perfect demo mode. Don't miss the submarine.

Amazing family day out. The Rahmi Koc museum is a paradise for lovers of old technology from tram cars to boats - and even features a real American WW2 submarine and a decommissioned Istanbul ferry! great restaurant also and lovely location on the Golden Horn.

For mechanic and technology lovers. This is one of the newest museums in Istanbul, almost 30 years old, the automotive and naval departments are very interesting. The museum area with various open/closed areas also hosts catering events, including weddings.

Very interesting museum. I want to thank the owner of this museum Mr. Koc!It is interesting to look at the different type of exponates: cars, trains, air planes, even real submarine!We had a nice and pleasant time when visited the museum despite nasty and cold weather! Recomment it!
Great!. Great collection of artefacts, big and small. Loved the dollhouse collection, the boats and the trains

Off the Tourist Route. This detour is worth your while. An unbelievable collection of cars, boats, planes, trains, buses...all kinds of memorabilia....even a ferry boat and submarine docked on the Golden Horn. Give yourself half a day here.

Amazing museum. Full of interesting pieces and the attention to detail is wonderful. You need a good couple of hours to walk through the entire place. Very glad we found this museum (quite by accident).

Technoly museum park. A fantastic tour in a beautiful site. Very interesting collection of different technolgies pieces. A pleasant way to pass half of a day outside the busy center and enjoying the Bosforos view. We had a light lunch in the local restaurant which was also ok. Try to reach it by the local boats.

Best places for old cars and dioramas. A very big museum that offers old cars, trains, planes and even a submarine. Beautiful examples of dioramas can be seen. It is just by the Golden Horn, with the lovely view of mosques you complete your visit in 2 hours.

A veritable gem. We didn't know about this museum beforehand just saw the boats as we went past on the ferry. It is excellent, based on one man's personal collection it still has that snse of personal involvment you often don't get in large state or municipal collections. The stuff that's there is there because it fascinated Mr Koc, his spirit is in the collection. Must-see? the beautifully restored Fiat railcar. Don't forget there's another building across the road with a wonderful collection of ship, loco and plane models as well as an excellent recreation of a ship's bridge. Do allow yourself at least three hours for both sites, they are well worth it.

Amazing Museum. A visit to this museum complex is really an amazing experience and try to give yourself a lot of time to visit. This museum is over a huge area and some parts are outdoors. It is dedicated to the history of transport , industry and communication and there is something for everybody. The displays are beautifully done and you will find items from miniatures to full sized boats and planes. There is various places to stop for something to eat or drink in different price ranges. I think for children this will be an exciting place to visit as they can partake in much of the exhibits. From Eminonu take bus 47, 47E or 47N and get off at the Kirmizi Minare stop or Ferry from Besiktas or the Big Bus Blue Route sightseeing tour. I can highly recommend this museum.

Sunday tour. What a wonderful place if your in interested in all modes of transportation. cars,carriages,boats,ships,aircraft were all present. the is one of the best transportation museums i been to offering something for every person. Bridal couples of Istanbul love to use this site for their weddings photographs. This must be on your agenda when visiting istanbul. this place is easily access using the hop-on hop-off red bus service

A MUST SEE. This Museum was an added bonus when we were just filling in the day before leaving Istanbul. It satisfies the motoring enthusiast, train enthusiast, Doll house enthusiast and every one in between. We only had an hour to spare but could have spent the whole day.

Great place. Whenever I go to istanbul this is the place I go every single time... Great place espacially for young children and for every age... The trains, cars, undersea part, dolls and much more... Just go and see and you will always remember as a good memory
must see!. heaven for children and even adults! Thanks to Koc family for this museum; every time we visit it's a new journey!

Highly recommended!. Awesome place to visit. Lots of things to be seen. It is well organized! I love the way the historic and modern transports being displayed. Toys are also included. It's a big place. It has been divided into few section based on type of transportation. At least we need to spent the whole day at the musuem. Its worth it. Dont miss the submarine session. You dont get any kind of chance to be in the submarine.Overall, dont miss this place whenever you visit Istanbul.

Not to be missed. You might think "I'm from Chicago, or New York or Boston, what could they possibly show me at a Technology Museum in Istanbul? This was one of the best I've ever visited. They have a wide variety of excellent exhibits from Automobiles, to Olive Oil processing equipment. Visit the submarine, the man who escorts you is great, knowledgeable and fun. Not to be missed, especially early in the morning when they open, and on rainy days.

Hard to find, but do not miss this vestige of a summer palace.. Take a taxi, and listen to the guide explain the history of the place. Worth the visit to see the intimacy of a domestic retreat as the Sultan promoted the work at the adjoining shipyard.

Fantastic place - something for everyone. Discovered this place by accident whilst on a ferry - you can easily spend all day here (I'd suggest bring your own lunch) - the museum is huge and eclectic (private collector).It's an easy ride on the ferry from the centre of Istanbul and be prepared to be amazed and visually exhausted by the end of day ! (in a good way) - You might have to drag the children away (I saw several crying on leaving !)It's not just for boys toys, there are lots of interesting exhibits, done in an immaculate fashion to an incredibly high standard. Strangely exhilirating place and very unusual.Highly recommended (and I'm not a trainspotter)....
Must see for everyone. the most under rated attraction of istanbul, the tour of the submarine and the dc 3 dakota is a must
Super interestig visit to the many technical attractions of this <museum. You can find in this Museum almost everything old : cars, trains, boats, plants,a plane, and even a real submarine !

A must for boys between 3 & 100 years old!!. This is the most amazing place I have visited in many years. Theis museum has it all, boats, cars, aircraft, machines. Many in working condition- from old steam to wood cutting, it is all there. This is a must, an absolute must and I am surprised that there is so little promotion done for this venue. The venue is accessable by either ferry or bus. It is a huge complex and needs many hours to visit. There is a little of everything and I mean - everything- from coaches, bicycles, baby prams, old military XRay trucks with huge batteries and and and. Go and see, view where what we take for granted today has come from.

Fantastic museum. The museum is easy accesible and the tickets cost almost nothing. We were a group of foreign student and they accepted our student id-s. The museum is awesome, there are large collections of cars, trains, boats, motorbikes and even planes and a submarine. You can step in many of the vehicles and take pictures everywhere you want. This is definitely a hidden tresure of istanbul and may be te best part of our week spent there.

fantastic museum of transport & technology. Amazing place, i saw it as i went past on the Big Bus Tour one evening, and went back the next morning. the bus stops right outside,and we went to the model village just before. Its a huge place with trains boats, submarines, cars, trams. also there are dolls houses, toys, and another section across the road that I did not have time to visit.

If you are interested .. go !. If you are seriously interested in following the development of the transportation facilities, visit this museum .. otherwise, don't waste your valuable time.The museum has a big number of different kind of vehcles, bikes, ....etc but lined up in such a way they are very close to each other.The easier way to reach the museum is by taxi.
Nice museum. Great museum at the center of Istanbul.Suggest to try the indian restaurants around the place.Nice sun reflection.

Don't miss this!. One of the very best transport museums anywhere - stuffed with cars, boats, aeroplanes and even traction engines. Easy to get to from the Galata ferry stop and great value for money. Even if you only have a passing interest in transport, do not miss this museum.

An October Sunday afternoon in Rami Koc Museum. The museum is in the shores of Halic. You can visit it easily with a taxi. in case of rain you can visit the interior part with the cars. This is a very interesting collection with cars from the past like Ford T to modern luxurious ones. There are also carriages, boats, airplanes and even a submarine. This is a world war II submarine used then by the Turkish navy. I dont recommend a visit to this to very tall persons or people who suffer from cleistophobia. The visitors can take photos in all exhibits of the museum, but not in the submarine. The visit its worth only if you have seen already all the principal sights of interest of Istanbul.
You will like it. Istanbul has enormous number of museums. Depending on your intereststhis is a nice one. You will like it for sure.

Top quality museum good restaurant. Very interesting items from all around the world are put together in this industrial museum. A good collection of antique cars, bikes, boats and various other items are very interesting for kids and adults. The restaurant is very pleasnt with a superb service.

excellent. A really nice surprise, lot and lots of old cars, trains, trolleys, planes, and on and on. Really surpassed my expectations. Accessible by slow local bus but I would recommend taking a taxi for about 3 USD from Beyoglu.

Rahmi Koc Museum: interesting. If you're interested in one of the early industrialists of Turkey, go. It contained a personal history -- not much of a history of industrialization in Turkey as such. Good place to visit if you're interested in this guy's life.If I am not mistaken, there was a train outside that might appeal to toddlers. That was one of the highlights for my five year old niece!
Nice Place. We went there after Golden Horn tour. It was really amazing. When you to Old Town you must visit museum.

Beyoglu - A must after visiting Taksim.. Beyoglu is a very vibrant and exciting area.The walking street offers many goods and services and the vintage trams which are called funiculars run right through the street.

Very Nice. I loved the Rami Koc museum because of its original art. I loved the design on the top of the dome and appreciate my girlfriend to have recommend this museum for me. I visited blue mosque and suleymaniye and want to say that this is also a must see museum in my opinion.

Peculiarly Good!. A feast of information and transport! Eclectic, interesting and well signed in English, there's a little bit of everything here, plus excellent places to snack or dine. Allow several hours!
Great place!!!. Great place to visit, many interesting thins to do here.Very well maintained also!The submarine visit was the best part, unfortunately the guide was only in turkish language.

Fun museum for all.. At the moment there is a special exhibition on doll houses. I particularly liked the little scene of a Turkish drawing room complete with nargile pipes and coffee. Regular exhibition includes boats, trains, aircraft and brightly painted and restored cars. Kids will like it as much as adults.

Are you a sailoror boating enthusiast ? This place had you in mind.. Very well done. Preserving best of Istanbul in a well organized modern structure. If you were there 30 years a go you will not be disappointed. If you are there for the first time, you will appreciate the wonderful life Istanbul use to have while enjoying modern cosmopolitan city.

The most underrated and best kept secret in town,a must visit. perhaps the best kept secret in Istanbul. A huge mueseum with something for everyone(my wife loved it after not really looking forward to it) It must have 20 aircraft,50 cars 12 boats ,plus steam engines. Also the largest collection of dolls houses you will ever see and,oh yes,not to forget a massive submarine you can tour from end to end for just an extra 5tl !
amazing collection. Gorgeous museum easy to reach with very low entry fees. It has lots old-style cars, models. We really enjoyed it. amazing collection
Excellent place to spend a day or two. Gorgeous museum with plenty of working mechanisms, old-style cars, boats, models. Great place for take your curious children to.
fantastic ..just go and visit it. amazing place ... fantastic its indeed a mirror of the industrial legacy....there u find old cars ships metros motorcycles airplanes ect ......
industry revolution age. Interesting museum, especially for middle ages, you can see a lot of historical equipments, also in the museum there is cafe, and there is car park area too.
Great place to visit with children. The museum is very easy to reach, cost of entry is almost nothing, and the collection is amazing. My son had a great time.

Visit it when you have enough time .... go with family. If you have enough time in your plan for Istanbul trip , you can add it in your schedule , especially if you are addicted to old cars .You have to ask about the public transport to reach there .
Kids will be amazed. Interactive history and science museum. Kids love it. On the Golden Horn. Wheel-chair friendly. Follow their site for novelties.

Surprising and very enjoyable.... I visited the museum several times in the last 15 years. Every time I went, I found sth. new. A museum is continuously improving itself. Wonderful Golden Horn view. If you have children do not miss this place...

One of Turkey's Most Interesting Museums. They even have a submarine tour!If you are interested how the machines at your house such as tv, dish washer , etc. works, and love to see old model cars, airplanes, even trains you have visit Rahmi Koç Museum.

Excellent Transport and Technology Museum. Superb array of vintage cars and buses.Beautiful locomotives, stylish railway carriages, and old trams.Well-maintained ferry and motorboat exhibits.Aircraft from the golden age of aviation.Old toys of all shapes and sizes.Model classic ships and locomotives.Tribute to Turkish cinema.Vintage Coca Cola memorabilia.Football signed by Pele.Vintage cameras, phonographs, tape recorders, typewriters, telescopes.Steamboat and miniature British steam train rides available.Waterside cafe and restaurant.And, you can go inside a World War II American submarine!Why wouldn't you go there?Best way to go there? Take a ferry from Karakoy, Eminonu or Kasimpasa pier, on the Halic Hatti Line and get off when you see the submarine i.e. at Haskoy. Ferries take 20 minutes (timing from Eminonu) and run hourly so check the timetable online.The museum has its Technology annex across the road, so don't forget to do that bit. Great trip for families or anyone interested in pretty much anything.You can literally spend hours there without getting bored, and the admission charge is very reasonableGive yourself a whole day and include riding the ferry on up the Halic (also known as the Golden Horn) to Eyup, a fascinating place with an historic mosque and loads of restaurants. Ferry fare is the same as an Istanbul bus fare! It makes a nice, tranquil change from the hectic tourist sites of Istanbul. Just go there....

Beautiful collection, very modern, well kept museum. Far from being a boring museum about the principles of physics or something similar, this is an exhibition of a collection of artifacts from a prominent Turkish businessman, whose legacy is still standing.For my experience, this is one of the best managed and best maintained attractions in Istanbul.The exhibition is very rich, with cars (really a beautiful collection, very well-kept), boats, trains, planes and even a submarine, plus pieces of machinery, reconstructed workshops and models, and lots of other things.Among some (many) rare pieces, a fully restored Italian "Littorina" locomotive, a railway car belonging to a Sultan and what remains of an American B24 Liberator having fought in the Ploesti Raid.For the committed person this museum can easily take 3 hours to visit, but even for a fast review plan 1.5 hours expecially with children.Unfortunately, this is not located close to any tramway stop, but it can be easily reached by boat (the stop is just besides the museum) or by the usual taxi.Don't miss it!

Nice cars. Free parking. Inexpensive cafe on site.. Nice cars, airplanes, submarine and trains. Cars are the best though. When we went there, museum was running a maintenance of some of the models and took them out for a ride first. Quite impressive to see models from 60-s up and running.

Best technical museum ever visited. Large museum with a lot of differend cars, planes, boats, trains and much more. Especialy the condition of the pieces is very good. Cars are shining like they came from the showroom a day before.If you hurry, you will see it in a day. So much too see.

Read the book in the Hotel and didnt go.. It was on the 'list' but it is more of a personal collection that a historic museum to learn about Turkey's heritage. Nevertheless it may be the only chance you have of visiting a submarine or London bus.
recommended to visit specially for kids. recommended to visit specially for kids very nice experience they will learn and see I personally love this museum

A great day out for kids. I spent 1/2 day with my son (11) who especially enjoyed the submarine tour (small extra cost-but well worth it!). The museum I is very clean and well organised, with several places to get cold drinks and ice creams, and a/c in the main buildings (it was about 33 degrees the day we visited). There are clean well-kept public parks either side of the museum, and we caught the ferry back to Istanbul (was only every 30 minutes, as it was a holiday,) but the journey down the Horn was great. We took a metered taxi here, which was reasonably priced.

Absolutely amazing!. Harry Potter's car, some old cars and ancient engines. Everything for the old vehicle lovers. Cadilacs, Citroens, Fiats.. Every brand you can imagine with their original conditions...
interesting place to see. It was great place to see here, we have spent 4 hours to visit and will see many edges of rahmi. highly recommend.

Amazing history. Dont get fooled by the name and pictures. It has a lot of educational and interesting artifacts from dignitaries from all over the world.
Trains, cars, doll houses for kids, letters and gifts to Mr. Koc from Kennedy to coke, airline companies.
A must see museum

Impressive Museum. I am not a car buff but was very impressed w this museum. Koc (or his staff) put careful attention to details. Guess being one if the richest men in Turkey means he has to look out for his name. The American classics (Chevys, Fords) looked better than ones I've seen in America. The restaurant had good food and service. There is a snack bar inside where one can sit to have coffee AND gaze at the cars! There are boat collections as well as a canoe-kayak collection.The fantastic boat ride (sbout 30? minutes) around the bay was included in admission price. My son, friend and I had a great time here!

U shouldnt skip it for you and your kids... We went there with my wife just for one hour;but we stayed almost 5 hrs...Museum is another planet which brings you beginnig of tecnology till present days...Also it is very nostalgic...It is amazing museum..I m a tourist guide in Istanbul ;I never seen this much well orginised museum ;it is because of the sponsor of the museum is most rich person of Turkey Mr .Rahmi Koç....There are thousands of amazing items...Also there is a beautifull cafe an old ferry which is so cheap...Also you can take a Golden Horn trip with a 170 yo ship with runs by heat of the coln...

Best technical museum I've seen. Impressive collection (5000+ pcs) of bikes, motors, cars, engines, tractors, ships, trains, planes and a real submarine from ww2 to visit! Very interactive (you can enter inside trains, planes, boats and the submarine) and full of stuff to see! Also contains real size replicas of living history shops (pharmacy, toy store, ship chandler, watchmaker, blacksmith, cobbler, chemist), a sawmill and an olive oil factory. Way better than the marine museum and the Islamic science and technology. Must see in Istanbul! Also a kids heaven! (hundreds of toys, cars, ships, train and plane models). Entrance is 14 TL + 6TL for the (real) submarine. Planetarium is 2TL but is only about Saturn exploration and in Turkish.

Great museum. If you want to get away from the tourist thing, this place is definitely worth it. Great fun, great collection. Take a half day at least. Warning: if entering the submarine bear in mind that the tour is in Turkish. At some point they are going to set off the (crazy loud!) dive alarm and you may get a heart attack! Beware if you are claustrophobic. Don't forget the second building across the street. Take the ferry up the golden horn

Thanks to Koç Group. Rahmi M.Koç Müzesi is one of the best private museums in Istanbul,located at the seaside in Haliç area.Very easy to come here by public transportation bus service and several boats from Üsküdar,Karaköy and Eminönü piers.Recommended to visit this very well arranged and maintained Museum as you will find out many interesting and exciting venues to see.
A lot to see a lot to do. There is soo much to see in this museum, different boats, cars and so much more. I loved it the only downside was that there wasn't that much information in english

truly amazing experience if you are into tech stuff. you can find from your childhood toys to a real battle submarine :) just visit and enjoy with no rush. Truly a good experience as well as a perfect location by the seaside. Worth visit and digest!
Worth to see. It is a private science museum. I think it is the best science museum in Turkey since there is not state offered science museum.
Fantastic. Nice museum mix between old and new transportation equipment starting from horses till planes passing by cars , trains , motorcycles and ships.
excellent. This was very interesting and there was absolutely nothing negative about the visit to the museum. Learned quite a lot there.

More than expected. Visited by chance. But I may add, a great surprise. Would definitely recommend. But take your time, and a camera, you ll have things to do around here. Not only see, experience, but also learn.

Wow eye opening for Western educated people. This is the museum of Islamic Science and Technology and it tells the story of science and technology that has not been taught in Western education institutions, and gives full credit to the Islamic and Asian scientists and all the great achivements.
surprisingly good. very nice small museum with lots of interesting and well described cars, steam engines, buggies, - a few boats and planes

Amazing place. This was a technology and transport museum and a real gem! Situated in a beautifully renovated space on the Golden Horn, it is easy to access by ferry from Eminonu (catch the ferry to Eyup and get off at Haskoy). Clean, well-labelled in English and with an amazing variety of technology and vehicles. Admission is very cheap compared to some of the other sights of Istanbul. For a small extra charge, you can join a tour of the submarine located in the water just outside the museum. This is a real submarine, decommissioned from the Turkish Navy, and is completely authentic. It was the highlight of my sons' visit to the museum. Great place to take the children.
Amazing Museum. It has everything from boats, planes, cars and memorabilia, even a submarine in a beautifully maintained setting

From Doll houses to airplanes !. Fantastic, grand exhibition of an era, from submarines to gorgeous Riva runabouts to cars and doll houses, train toys, and everything in between. By the water. Nice views of an arm of the Bosphorus.Not to be missed !
perfect museum. the museum was perfect. everything is awesome. everybody who s been istanbul should see this museum.
Cars, trains, trams, submarine. Good research tour for pupils. But it is concept of a dozen personal collections. So conceptually it is far from Museum.
Automobiles. One of the best museum in Europe. You can set the historical review of oldu automobiles and many historical old art things such as pictures , materials and sea Equipments.

A great museum with something to interest everyone.. Having a transport mad husband I have been to numerous museums all over the place and visiting another on a very hot day was not one I was thrilled about. How wrong could I have been, this museum was absolutely fantastic, beautifully looked after and had something for everyone - even the Doll's House museum - see if you can spot the labrador in a kennel!! The vast collection includes planes, trains, bikes, motorcycles, fantastic cars - including one to delight Harry Potter fans, engines of all kinds, steam engines, boats, and a WW2 American submarine that saw action in the Pacific and later sold to Turkish Navy. Take my hat off to those brave men who served in her - it was an unforgettable experience. Nice little gift shop, smiling and helpful staff, plenty of loos and a nice cafe. If you want a nice lunch there is also a waterfront restaurant (not part of museum) that was lovely. Take a little ferry from the harbour - not where the bigger boats are, walk further on, under the underpass and go past the bus terminal to a small ferry (your Istanbul travel pass works) and get off at the 2nd stop. Ferrries are on the hour. This was in the end a lovely day and well worth it!

Car buffs and engineers will really enjoy this wonderfully fun museum. What an artful and clear depiction of man's achievements with machinery. Great displays, some active! The submarine was an extra charge, paid for when purchasing a museum ticket. The restaurant was nice although nothing special.

Amazing Collections. Wow,it was one of the best.I liked the cars and old machines,especially the one for making olive oil.We had fun.It is also located by the Golden Horn so that we could go there by boat from Eyüp easily.I recommend every Turkish Citizens and the tourist to go there if they ever find a chance.

Treasure trove. Its a wonderful museum - rare to find so much variety : air, water, road transport. A lot of history here.Cafetaria by the water was very nice. The submarine is also an added attraction.

For Classic Car Lovers and everyone. If you love classic cars, old boats, plane, trains this is a place you should go. Your children also will love it.What I love most is after you finish the museum visit, go the museum restaurant. Either eat something or just have a drink near the water and breath the history inside of you. Fantastic location every minute worth spending. Also you can rent some areas of the museum for special occasions and events. Definitely an unforgettable experience.

Awesome collection of classic cars!. This museum is definitely worth seeing. Lots of cool classic cars, old boats and trains, and a cool science area for kids. The cafe inside is quite cheap - and it's easy to get to from Sultanahmet by taxi or Uber.

Absolutely must if visiting with children. The name of this museum kept popping up whenever I searched for things to do with children in Istanbul and our visit there made it clear why. It is an absolute gem of a museum that will delight and fascinate children and adults alike. Its essentially a transport museum with a little bit of history of Kemal Ataturk thrown in as well. But the Transportation Museum is beyond amazing with something for everyone. With an immense collection of all types of transports that include vintage cars and two wheelers, boats, small ships, trains, trams, planes and to top it all an actual submarine, this place is a veritable treasure house. My kids and I must say me and my husband loved every minute that we spent there. I would suggest you go have a look even if not travelling with kids as its a wonderful experience for adults as well.Getting there is easy by taxi or bus (starting from Eminonu with the bus stop right at the gate of the museum). But do make it a part of your Istanbul itinerary, you won't regret it!

Interesting museum. This is a museum with very interesting collections of old cars, boats, old computers and even very early washing machines. As part of Koc group we go there for a New Year's dinner party and I always love to stroll inside this lovely museum. I suggest all tourists to pay a visit here.

Amazing. Incredible. And beautifully presented.. We passed this on the ferry en route to Miniaturk, and my husband insisted that we try to get back to it another day. We did - and I'm so glad we made the effort!It's easy to get to by ferry from Eminonu: jump off at Haskoy and it's just a couple of minutes walk round the corner. There's a 12tl fee to get in to the museum - but we spent 3 hours there and didn't get to see half of the exhibits, so it is a full day out and well worth the money.The museum is so much more than just historical and educational. We started with the Rahmi M Koc and the Ataturk rooms, which were absolutely full of memorabilia. So many pieces from so many amazing places and events - it makes you wonder where Mrs Koc kept them all before the museum was built! Then there's a special exhibition room: when we went there were beautiful dolls houses on display. There are rooms and rooms of cars, boats, trains, steam vehicles, engines, planes, bikes, motorbikes, dolls prams, horse drawn carriages... There are model shops, a model sawmill, and a model olive oil factory. There's a display of toys old and new. There are machines that work when you press a button. There are interactive displays. There are trams and cars, ferries and planes you can climb into. There are videos, hands-on activities, things to touch and things to play with.Each and every exhibit is in stunning condition, with a story or an explanation or a piece of history for you to read. There is a map that will guide you round (though we thoroughly enjoyed wandering). We met groups of school children, groups of teenagers, adults, inquisitive toddlers... every age group seemed to find something that fascinated them. There are a number of food & drink areas, with a range of styles and a range of prices.There is, across the road, a second site with what looked like a gorgeous café. We just didn't have any time to go and explore it. We didn't have time to do a guided tour of the submarine either (you need to buy a separate ticket for this). Which means we have a great excuse for going back another time!
Interesting place. Rahmi Koc Museum is like small version of the science museum. You will find a great collection of classic cars which I was fascinated by.

Fantastic and Educational Visit. This historical and educational Transport Museum is well worth a visit.My husband and I visited and certainly had a fantastic time. We were most impressed by all the exhibits, the vintage cars, aeroplanes, boats and many more, evendolls houses.The museum is extremely well laid out and informative. It has much to offer to both adults and children. In addition to the exhibits there is also a train, steam boat and a submarine. These can be enjoyed for little extra cost. It was fun to be on the train with all the happy children enjoying their day out The cruise on the "Rosalie" around the Golden Horn was an extra treat.It was a unique experience for both of us to have a voyage on an 1873steam boat. Our tour around the submarine, TCG Ulucalireis, was alsomost interesting.We spent well over four hours at the museum and still there was a lotmore to see. We will certainly visit next time we are in Istanbul andwill be recommending our friends to visit.

If you like the Henry Ford Museum in Michigan . It's a mini version of the Henry Ford museum and if you liked that place, you will like this as well. Especially if you like anything with a motor as I do. This place has it all. It's going to cost you a cab ride there and back on top of admission as it's not really near public transportation. I went on a Saturday and it was nearly empty. Three times as many employees then visitors. Have no idea how this place stays open financially and I would be surprised if it's still around in 10 years. If you have the time it's a great place to visit.
One of a kind. One of the greatest places which I have been to.Enjoyed every moment discovering historical industries.Amazing cars trains airplanes machines and a lot more

Very informative and lovely museum. Me and my husband went to this after my husband insist me. After going there I was thankful to him for bringing me there. As Istanbul is full of museums and historical places u may think it's also of same type bt it was totally different vast explanation of all the transport ways, working of some electronic things which work on ur command(push button),collection of different cars specially vintage ones and lot more. It was huge museum so you should have plenty of time. There is one submarine also Bt you have to buy its ticket separately one person will explain all the section of submarine and also give u certificate . Also there is one more section opposite to road which has planetarium, cafe and some more stuff. I was really surprised by looking the size of museum. And my favorite section was Doll houses don't miss it

Maybe interesting for the locals, but not for a tourist. I did not come 8,000 miles to see old industrial, shipping, or other artifacts. But lots of school kids were there. Just not for international tourists

Great place to visit for adults and children. This museum houses an interesting collection of ancient cars and mechanical equipment (including old washing machines, etc.) It is situated in a beautiful corner of Istanbul by the sea. It is really worth seeing.

Visiting this Very interesting Museum is a must. this Museum has Very beautiful collections of objects reflecting the technological development of the 19th century to date, meanwhile, you can visit the inside of a submarine of American origin bought by Turkey. so all these interesting explanations could be in Turkish, English, French or German. the Museum entrance fee is 12.5 lire / person. worth it/

Great place for pretty much anyone.. This museum has a terrific collection of cars on display, as well as boats, planes, trains and a pretty good educational section for kids and science buffs. You can tour through an ex-navy submarine at certain times of the day which is very interesting. It's not expensive and there should be plenty of interest for pretty much any visitor.
A must do amongst everything else. Save a day for this amazing place. It is truely impressive. From Cars to planes. Doll houses to saws. Bicycles to submarines. Its got it all.

very nice.... Its very nice but far from the old city,need to take a taxi or use public transportation to go there,you will see the modern art of Turkey and ottoman empire,very beautiful calligraphic as well,recommended...
well decorated. good , impressed welldone exhibitions decoreted by profession dont be hurry just enjoy the time especially at your second hall you will be fly
Amazing Place. Everything is fantastic there...I could spend hours and hours checking every details of the items exposed...

Beyond expectations!. I couldn't even imagine how huge the collection of this museum is! If you are in Istanbul and have any interest in technology then don't miss. If you come with kids - don't miss either, they'll enjoy it more than anything in the city. Cars, planes, ships, trains, submarine, working models of engines, full-size model of olive oil factory - this is just a small part of what they have in Rahmi Koc Museum. You can easily spend an entire day without getting bored. We went on a weekday and there were very few people on this big territory so we virtually had the whole exposition to ourselves. All items have detailed descriptions in English. The price was around 12 TL for adults and 8 TL for students which is more than reasonable. One of the best museums I've visited in my life!

Great. Planes, trains, cars, boats, submarines, bycycles, motorcycles, different types of engines, even an olive oil factory are displayed along with first industrial professions and tools. A short ride with an old train is part of the entrance fee, however, submarine tour is subject to additional payment. Inside the boat, there is also an exhibition on model boats. A part of the museum is dedicated to items collected during the world tour Rahmi Koç made couple of years ago with his boat. Indeed, majority of the artifacts displayed at the museum are from his personel collections.
Excellent museum. A treat for every one, young and old, an eclectic collection of transport related items, including a DC-3 and a submarine, but also a superb collection of dolls houses.

very interesting industrial museum. I really liked all. Because It is possible to see all developments in the history of industry. Boats, cars, trains, planes, ships, all kind of electric and electronic equipments etc. You must go and see . You will like it.

Great views. One of the best maintained and richest museums in Istanbul that mainly focuses on Industry and industrial history. There are many historical pieces such as an old passenger plane, a submarine, many trains and an incredible car collection. The transportaition is easy and the price is acceptable. Recommended for families especially.

Museum with a difference. This is more of a collection than a museum as such - it has beautiful collections of a wide variety of items (eg cars, boats, bicycles, prams, household equipment etc) There are working models, as well as a ride on mini-train. Definitely well worth a visit. The collection is vast and well set out.

A gem, maybe the most fun place in Istanbul!. After spending quite some time in Istanbul and visiting almost everything that should be visited, I have to say that in Rahmi Koc Museum we had the most fun! It needs at least 3-4 hours - there is a very interesting and informative section about Ataturk which should not be missed. But the biggest fun is the huge (huge!!) collection of rare and expensive classic cars and boats, also there is a submarine, coaches, trams, (one can enter them), and many other extremely interesting exhibits.Very conveniently there is also a nice restaurant overlooking the Golden Horn - great place to have an early dinner with a bottle of chilled local white wine while watching the sunset!

Great museum. Where to start? Very informative first section on Kemal Ataturk with interesting newspaper clippings from the 1920s, Time Magazine covers, and some of his clothing and other personal items. Some great photos, too. Then, on a different note, there are rooms of the most magnificently restored cars. There are areas with old tramway cars and buses, rooms full of seagoing vessels and associated paraphernalia ... We spent three hours here, but that wasn't nearly enough time, and if we are lucky enough to return to Istanbul, we will come back here to finish our visit. Oh, and we had a lovely lunch here at the restaurant overlooking the water. Pricy, but great food. Almost forgot to mention two special exhibitions on currently, one of dolls houses, the other a photographic exhibition of veterans from Turkey and Aus. and NZ, of the Gallipoli campaign. Very moving.

Excellent Place. well, this was the one the awesome place. the museum had great facilities. Me and my friends had great experience
Would visit again...soon

Brilliant hidden gem. A friend tipped is off about this museum and it's well worth a visit. Lots of old cars, ships, a sub, doll houses. An eclectic but fun mix. We got the ferry there and back - there is one an hour and we were lucky with timing.Well worth a few hours of your day. You get the boat down from the main ferry terminal and past the bus station. They're often a bit late which can work to your advantage. A cab to the museum shouldn't be too much either but the boat is a great way to travel.

An out of the way Museum Gem. My son and I visited this museum only because a bus tour passed by it early in our stay and it looked interesting. There isn't much promotion of the display... it's a little off the tourist beaten track. A 2TL/10 min ferry ride from the south side of the Golden Horn and a 200 metre walk from the ferry got us to the front door. There are many early transport and other generational displays to interest the whole family. Amongst many other catergories, on display...... horse and carriage through to the evolution of the motor vehicle,,,,,,motor bikes from the early 1900's onwards.....sizeable doll houses...... memorabilia from Turkish and Australian armies (WW1).......trams..... planes....and so on. A bit of a gem if you are looking for comparisons between generations.
Neat museum. Really random and cool museum we found while taking the Halic ferry. It's worth a visit for sure to see these kind of objects. Definitely good for families.

Great Museum amazing collections. This is a private museum. It has probably the largest collection of vitage cars that one can see under one roof. Not just cars it has collection of vehicles of all modes of transport right from steam engines to ships and aircraft. All the items (vehicles) on display are in superb condition and a treat to watch. If you are in Istanbul and taking Bosporus tour; look for a tour that includes "Rahmi M. Koc Museum".

Make the effort!. Terrific museum for families if you are interested in planes trains automobiles submarines dolls houses trams you will be blown away by this museum. Great resteraunts esp the one right near the entrance. Catch the bus from Istanbul bus stops right outside. Fantastic room upstairs opens after 3 pm with great maths concepts to explore. Teenagers and kids will enjoy.

Rahmi M. Koc Museum a must with kids. Fab museum collection of vintage cars, airplanes, trains and even a submarine. So much more too.... Local kids were having class in a train carriage! My 10 year old absolutely loved this

So Very Glad We Visited. Koc, pronounced Coach. A wonderful Transport Museum.As we love seeing the world through the kids eyes. We LOVED this museum as much as our 10 and 8 year old BUT we found ourselves taking photo after photo for other adults at home that we wanted to share this experience with as we know they would have loved it too. From cross-sections of household appliances "I always wondered what happens in a dishwasher" Miss H said, olden day cars of all shapes and sizes, and boats and trains and planes. Planes to go inside of too. Private jet "oooohhh, this would be cool" and another "ooooohh this is like the plane from the Madagascar movie". The remnants of a fighter plane from wartime and all the history to go with all these things if we so desired to stand and read. Then there was the display of dollhouses and miniature scenes from Turkey. If you love attention to detail. The intricacy in these displays is worth a visit alone. There were the life size models of blacksmith stores and old shops.And then there was the submarine. It was an additional cost to do this and even though the guide only spoke Turkish. It was still worth.We paid 25TL each way by taxi from the Sultanahmet to Rahmi M. Koc and we're very glad we did. We would definitely visit again.

A Lot to See. Located on the eastern shore of the Golden Horn, this large museum concentrates on different modes of transportation and motive technology. You will find broad collections of automobiles, steam engines, trains/cars and boats. There is even a diesel submarine (extra cost with designated tour time). Also included is an excellent diorama section (not really the "doll houses" written on the sign), an old wood working shop, some airplanes, and some full-scale replicas of different sorts of shops common at the beginning of the industrial revolution. A ferry from the Eminönü terminal (north of the others past the big bus terminal) has a stop adjacent to the museum.While I especially recommend this museum if you are touring with school-age children it is also very interesting for adults. A fair number of interactive exhibits are included. I especially enjoyed walking through a wonderfully restored Italian train car (a powered one-car passenger train) from the 1930s.

Great Museum. Lots to see here, if you like transport related things. Some really nice cars and motor bikes here and they even have a dispal of the oldest metiorite that has been found. The Museum is big so you will need a bit of time to look round it and the ferries only go every hour. The cafe was ok and reasonably priced but the restraunts are expensive so if you are a big familly and on a budget take a packed lunch.

Great Museum. We walked here from the Galata Tower (not a fun walk, take a taxi or the water taxi/ferry, get off on the Eminonu stop on the light rail, walk past the Galata Bridge to the ferries).The museum is really quite nice, tons of classic/interesting cars, boats, miniature houses, airplanes, train cars and industrial equipment (ever seen a steamroller from the 1910s? You will here). It is a very well kept museum, and they have a nice little cafe adjacent to the main car show room. The submarine tour was great as well, so I recommend spending a couple of bucks to get that add-on. Just an FYI, the train ride is essentially an activity for small kids, as the train goes back and forth on a little track, fine, but as an adult you aren't missing much. If you are tight for time in Istanbul, yeah, you might not see this, but my wife and I really enjoyed it, worth the trip over, really neat way to spend 2-3 hours, so I would highly recommend the museum.

Excellent for kids - and grown-ups!. Bringing our son to Istanbul, we tried to find some attractions he would like as well. The Rahmi Koc museum was absolutely marvellous. In fact, we were so fascinated by this museum that we spent more than five hours here. And our son still didn't want to leave! Old cars, motorcycles, engines, how computers work, submarines, trains, planes and many other items of interest presented in a very neat way and pedagogical. We have been at museums like London's Science museum. The Rahmi Koc matches this museum. Not necessarily along the same lines of content, but at least through its quality. This is a very complete collection of vehicles of various sorts.At the top shelf was the visit in the submarine. Here you met volunteers, which previously served in the turkish navy. The officer who guided us were a former machine engineer in the submarine, and could tell us lots of details.There is an entrance fee, but it is nevertheless cheap.

Interesting. A last moment addition to the itinerary, this proved to be a great fun than anticipated. The collections are definitely vast and impressive and seem to have something for every age group but frankly I feel that it would be the kids that would enjoy the museum much more. Ample things to see and learn. It can be a bit time consuming so prepare your visit accordingly. There are lots of transportation collectibles around and that too in various forms.

One Of The Best. The Koç Museum is one of the best museums I've visited anywhere in the world. Interesting and vast exhibitions for visitors of all ages, but especially entertaining for those intrigued by technology and mechanics; a separate section about hands-on physics and mechanical learning will keep children entertained, as well. Excellent translations and information in English. Highly recommend a visit for a few hours!

We have to go again... and again, and again!. Great place. Went with my 8 year old boy - just fabulous! Only trouble is it is so big. So we went again when he was 9 and we will have to go again because we still haven't ogled at everything. So many bikes and planes and ships and cars. And so cheap too! Love the place.

Absolutely must see if you are with children. This museum was the one which our 6 year old son liked the most. Collection is very large and quite interesting. A lot of working presentations to show how things built and work could entertain you for quite a time. Unfortunately, we had not enough time to visit all collection but definitely we'll be back here on our next trip.

Definitely not to miss when you return in Istanbul. First seen in a previous visit in Istanbul from the touristic bus, the museum offers a lot of interesting stuff. By far, the most interesting is the visit in an old submarine used by Americans in the Second World War in Pacific, then later modernized and sent to Turkish Army. In addition to this, you can see also a large range of means of transport from various times

Much more than we expected to see. Our guide took us to this museum as part of our Golden Horn Tour. We took a ferry from Eminent and was at the museum in 20 minutes. It's a great approach right on the water with a submarine, Dakota air-plane, many small vintage boats. These are all toys of a famous businessman!
Perfect museum by the sea. Not very close to city center.We took a taxi from Sultanahmet area.Good to visit with kids.It is very large and have lots of things to see so be sure to have enough time.
Cool collection of technical stuff. Reall big collection of cars, trains, trams, planes, ships, boats and steam engines. Worth seeing even not only for kids.

Rahmi Koc Museum need to be visited. I visited this museum after 15 years again with my family. I really loved it and happy that it made a wonderful progress. Location is excellent, Rahmi Koc is a great collection-er of classical cars, trains, planes and lots of other vehicles and so many other things.
Surrounding buildings and coffee shops are excellent also, Really, worth seeing this museum.

Simply the best. This is the best museum I have ever visited all over the world. The diamond among Istanbul's attractions, absolutely unexpected in such kind of old historical city. Somewhere It is called a technological museum, but in reality it gives much much more than just a review of a history of technologies.You can see, you can touch, you can try& learn, you can play... I wish one day I could come back and bring my kids here The only man who really loved the things could create such amazing and friendly museum.

enjoyable place and full of info. Nice museum. Bring there your children , I am sure they will enjot it so much. Location is easy to find and full of information about Turkish past industrial development

You have to go there minimum one time. Very good place to go with your family. Spent your weekend in there food, park and sea side. Old Istanbul beyon on your feet.Your children will ove it too much. You can go there very easy. Public tranport also take you there easily.

Good collection of machinery. A nice technology museum, an excellent collection of cars, motorcycles, various engines. There are also a couple of restaurants with excellent atmosphere and kind people.
nice. very old arts nice old planes nice antiques everything was wonderful like all day you can stay and see
Exciting. This was a place that consisted many things i've never seen before. So exciting and good place for kids.
Amazing.... It is quite worth to see . Not just ınly classic cars , many things to see . Specially baby dolls houses were amazing . Took almost 5 hours to travel .

Travel with kids. If you are travelling with kids you should take them to this attracting museum. Kids can have fun between trains, old cars, even planes and submarine. Also the Restaurant named Halat in the garden of the museum offers good meal and service

Antiques. A very large museum with various antiques. Has a place for everything, from old classic cars to dollhouses. Also has an old submarine that you can go onboard but book your tour as you get your ticket because it's a bit difficult to find ticket. For those that like old stuff.

Very good. This Museum is one of the pioneers of the Richard'da family Museums. Itil is Near to Golden horn.
Especially the vehicles are worth to see.

Must visit, be a couple or a family. Where can I start ? There are antique cars, vessels like trains- numerous types of planes, a typical Bosphorus ferry, a mini toy museum, a ship, a submarine and more at that museum. It's a very good spot for everyone to visit including children and couples. There are 2 restaurants you can eat or drink at if you get tired. I highly recommend paying extra for the submarine visit.

Good for families and Children. If you have children into machines, cars, and other gadgets I suppose this is a primary destination to visit.There is a real plane and a submarine you can enter in, oh and a ferry you can play around.
Great. This building really great. Very historical atmosphere and good location i was hear this building from my friends and now i saw here and really like it.

Learn and Enjoj. If you go there, you are going to enjoy very much. This is a very huge place. There are a lot of interesting things in the museum. For example there are old and new cars, old bicycles, wooden toys. trains and a wonderful airplane.Morever, children will love the museum. The museum has got magnificent parts for them. I am amazed for doll's houses. You must see them. They are very pretty. You can play games with your partner or your child. Do you want to learn and enjoy ? Okey, then you must go Rahmi Koc Museum. Do not miss out this opportunity !

The Best Thing To Do With Your Kid. Are you bored of going to shopping malls on each weekend, taking kids to loud play grounds or buying toys or clothes all time? Do you want to share good time with your kid? Would you like to visit an old train, a submarine, a ship and a plain in a day? Do you like cars? How about doll's house and a planetarium? I visited Koc museum with my 6 year old son and his friend and they become so excited. I felt so good to be able to experience this world class museum with them. Please spend all day in Koc Museum. Hope to visit other museums soon :)
Nice to photograph. Nicely organized, and nice to photograph. Photographer will definitely enjoy themselves. The old American cars are nice to see.

Very nice. This is a very huge place with so many things on displays. The vintage collection is vast and there's even a room at the second floor to test our knowledge and skills. There's even a mini train ride outside. Kids will love the place.We didn't get to tour the submarine but spend a good few hours walking around.

Museum by the Sea. A fantastic place for young and older kids alike, this museum is down by the Golden Horn. There's a planetarium, a submarine, a nostalgic railway, and a host of other things to see. The museum is open everyday from 10 am except Mondays, and prices are very good value, although you will have to pay for the submarine and the planetarium. Temporary exhibitions at the moment include Hector of Troy and a dollshouse collection - there really is something for everyone here. If you're taking a bus, get off at the Kırımzı Minare, but the metrobus stop at Halicioglu is only 10 minutes walk, and ferries from Uskudar stop at Eyup. Wheelchair and stroller access is very good and there's a rather charming little cafe on site for food and drinks.

Just perfect!. If you like Science Museum in London, you will like it in Rahmi Koc Museum. And I believe you will like it more as it is in on the seaside with beautiful view. It is amazing definitely. A whole set of old cars, toys, science equipment and many more old devices. The museum is very large so make sure to have at least 4-5 hours. There are aircraft, trains, older vehicles, and even a submarine in front of the museum which you can visit with a guided tour. I really enjoyed it. If you have children, it could be fun for them as well :) By the way, there are also packages with Bosphorus cruises. In my opinion, the entrance fee is for low the value they offer :)

Excellent Place to Visit with Kids in Istanbul. Although i put the title of my review as "Excellent Place to Visit with Kids in Istanbul", I have to emphasize that it is also a great place to visit for adults? As a person, who has visited several museums in Europe and North America, I can assure you that this is an excellent and unique industrial museum with large selection of new and old cars, motor bikes, boats, ships, trains, airplanes, interactive science experiments, and demonstrations of industrial processes to enjoy. I and my son have visited this place several times and it has been never boring. It will be a great experience for you and your kids. You can easily spend the whole day in the museum. Even if you are short in time, you should consider spending at least your whole afternoon. For quick and inexpensive lunch, you can grab something from the sandwich bar in the ship parked on the Golden Horn (there is a small souvenir shop near the sandwich bar selling toys and a few inexpensive items that you and your kids may enjoy) or enjoy an upscale lunch/dinner (excellent food, but expensive) at the restaurant looking at the Golden Horn. Finally, there is a short, but nice train ride in the museum that you should consider buying tickets for you kids.
Wonderful museum. Highly recommend to visit this museum. Most of all I liked a nice collection of old and rare car models.
Good for children. The staff of the hotel we stayed recommended this local museum of vehicles. It is easy to access from even the Old City. Our children enjoyed.
Far but interesting. There is something for everyone at this museum, it is such a cornucopia of cool stuff, do pay a visit. We took a taxi to and from Galata tower, it was about 15 TL each way.

Leave Ottoman behind and meet Turkey. When you travel to Istanbul, you can find your self in the path of Ottoman, but wait this country is not called Ottoman anymere, here is Turkey. So if you want to see something about Turkey, the path where this country has come from, Koc Museum is the place to go.You can find many details of Turkish civilisation after Ottomans and understand how a new culture tried to be created after an empire has fallen down.A must seen I belive.

Very interesting place. A museum like this you will not find often. There you can plenty of vehicles, divided in separate halls, such as automobiles, motorcycles, locomotives and wagons, airplanes, helicopters, a tank and a real submarine - all dating from a wide period of time.There is a hall with the main domestic appliances, given in a transparent cross section, showing how they work when you press the START button. Other sections exhibit various equipment, such as communications, measuring, scientific devices, etc. There are explanations both in Turkish and English. There is a number of cafes with reasonable prices in the area.The tour in the submarine is very interesting and you will be given a diploma at the end. By the way - children below 8 years of age are not allowed due to safety reasons, and you will have to pay extra fee for the submarine. The easiest way to get there is to take the bus 47, 47E, 47C form Eminonu bus station, close to the ferries and to hop off at Kırmızı Minare Durağı bus stop. I can say it from personal experience, as the first time I visited the museum, I took a taxi but the driver got lost while searching for it.I highly recommend that you visit the museum, especially the kids will have a lot of fun.
Excellent museum. Great display of historical cars , marine life, educational subjects for all ages. You can spend an entire day in exploring the rich historical sections.

Fun for teenage boys of all ages and both genders. This museum is not a transport museum, it's not a technology museum and it's not a science museum. Neither is it a comprehensive display of historically-important artefacts. It is, broadly speaking, the gigantic private collection of a rich individual who liked cool techie stuff. Thus, you will see steam engines of all types - most of them with buttons to make the pistons go up and down. You will see a large collection of classic cars, e.g. The Model 'T' Ford, Cadillacs, Jaguars. You will see Harley Davidson motorbikes, a large collection of old Apple computers, and countless diving helmets. There is movie-making equipment, a semi-working olive oil factory, a huge collection of speed boats (and a dugout canoe), countless steam trains, tanks, light aircraft... And even (drum roll) a US submarine that you can tour around, which is moored in the Golden Horn (you have to pay extra).If that description makes you go 'ooh, cool!', you are the target audience of this museum... We went on Boxing Day (26 Dec) when the place was almost empty except for a wedding reception, and we were the only two people touring the submarine in the last spot of the day. We toured with a former Turkish submarine engineer of twenty-five years standing who could speak enough English to make it interesting. All the exhibits are in English and Turkish.We had lunch in the Cafe au Levant, which is a perfectly nice French bistro on the site. There is also a coffee shop and a sit-down restaurant (or possibly two sit-down restaurants). The only downer was getting to/from the museum without private transport (as a British tourist). We walked, having been to Chora in the morning. The route back to Galata Bridge/Sultanahmet was through an industrial estate with poor pavements in the rain.

World Class. This is among the best industrial museums I have ever visited. The displays are beautiful and creative, the buildings are also part of the attraction. The wide ranging exhibits are impeccably maintained. There are many places to comfortably sit and enjoy the surroundings, as well as a couple of places for coffee and snacks. And there is a beautiful restaurant. The only short coming is that is not easy to get to unless you're adventuresome and don't mind finding your way on busses and the metro. Do not take a taxi in Istanbul. You WILL be cheated. I had read the many warnings posted in Trip Advisor and I ignored that advice and was cheated out of over 50tl - and had a trip ruining screaming match at the side of the road with the driver. Forget filing a complaint with the police. Each of three police stations referred us to another one, so we gave up.

absolute must to visit!. you can easily send two days there.Our whole family was absolutely excited with every santimeter of this museum! the top experience was the REAL submarine! 30 min inside doesnt happen every day. Plus, retro cars, beautiful old boats, trains, planes. tasty restautants on the side of Golden Horn. and we still have the second part of a musum to visit on the other side of the road.
Excellent. It is really a remarkable place which is maintained well. I can also recommend Cafe du Levant, the upscale restaurant within the museum. It is pricey though.

Kids will love this. If you are planning a trip to Istanbul with kids, this is a must see. An Individual collector's collection(amazing, that!) of cars, trains, boats, planes, bikes, gadgets, and submarine(!) all beautifully and aesthetically presented. My 3 yr old absolutely loved the interactive, transparent household appliances (dishwasher, washing machine, vacuum cleaner, etc) that showed her the inner workings of everyday gadgets. The display of the workings of car engines, bikes and cycles were also superb.
